intro: Zahlbrucknera micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered zahlbrucknera, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a fine layer of hairs. Zahlbrucknera micrantha is often found in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests and stream banks.
